titleStmt.title: A letter from the Isle of VVight, of the designe to have gotten the King from the Isle of Wight. The iron barre of the window broken, and two horses and a boat ready to carry his Majesty away. Mr. Douset, Mr. Osburne, and others committed to prison. And a great victory against the Cavaliers that rise in the west, many killed and taken, and divers drowned. With the particulars of the said fight, certified in a letter to a Member of the House of Commons. June. 1. 1648. Imprimatur, Gilb. Mabbott.

A letter from the Isle of VVight, of the designe to have gotten the King from the Isle of Wight. The iron barre of the window broken, and two horses and a boat ready to carry his Majesty away. Mr. Douset, Mr. Osburne, and others committed to prison. And a great victory against the Cavaliers that rise in the west, many killed and taken, and divers drowned. With the particulars of the said fight, certified in a letter to a Member of the House of Commons. June. 1. 1648. Imprimatur, Gilb. Mabbott.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for H. Becke, and are to be sold in the Old Bayley,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
